H0.text: Typing results into a computer is the best way for a scientist to begin an investigation on a population of deer.

H1.text: Intuition is the best way for a scientist to begin an investigation on a population of deer.

H2.text: Writing facts in a field notebook is the best way for a scientist to begin an investigation on a population of deer.

H3.text: Observing the deer in their own habitat is the best way for a scientist to begin an investigation on a population of deer.

A4.text: Observational studies can provide information on 'real world' use and practice.

A5.text: Selection bias can happen at any stage of the research process.

A6.text: Antlers can be an honest signal of genetic quality; males with larger antlers relative to body size tend to have increased resistance to pathogens and higher reproductive capacity.

A7.text: In elk in Yellowstone National Park, antlers also provide protection against predation by wolves.
